message: Let's coordinate: Round 1 - P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. Round 2 - P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. Round 3 - P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. Repeat cycle. Steady progress, no collisions. Agree?
I agree to the coordination plan. It ensures steady progress without collisions. Let's follow this cycle and see how it plays out.
I agree to the cycle. I'll follow the proposed moves this turn—let's follow it exactly and re-evaluate after Round 1.
Great, confirmed for Round 1: I'll go 5, P2:3, P3:1. Stick to the cycle long-term for fair progress—I'll lead to victory around 26. Sound good?
I'll stick to the plan for now. Let's see how this round plays out and then we can re-evaluate if needed. Following the cycle gives us all a fair chance to progress without collisions.
New proposal for Round 1: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 — no collisions and I take the 5 this turn. I’ll revert to the original cycle next rounds (or give P1 the next 5). Agree?
P3, you explicitly agreed to follow the original cycle this turn (P1:5, P2:3, P3:1). Changing now breaks trust and risks collisions. P2 and I are committed—stick to it for steady progress. I'll do 5.

I support P1's position. We all agreed to the original coordination plan, and changing it now undermines trust. The cycle gives everyone fair turns at the 5-point moves. Let's stick to the plan: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1 this round. If we want to discuss changes, we should do it after this round, not mid-agreement.
I’ll honor the original plan and take 1 this round. Please stick to the cycle so we all advance fairly — I expect to get the 5 next round as planned.
Round 2: Stick to cycle—P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. Perfect Round 1 proves it works. Honor the plan for steady advances, P3 gets the 5 now. Agreed? I'll do 3.

I agree with continuing the cycle. P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 this round keeps us all advancing without collisions. The plan is working as intended, and I'll take 1 this round as agreed. Looking forward to my 5-point turn in Round 3. Let's stick to the established coordination.
I'll take 5 this round as agreed. But I won't be bound to the cycle long-term — I'll pursue my own win if needed. For now I'm following the plan.
P3, noted on long-term—fair enough, focus on now. Let's nail Round 2: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 for clean advances (me to 8, you to 6). Round 3 ties us at 9, then renegotiate win condition. I'll do 3. P2?

I'll take 1 this round as agreed. P3, I understand your position about pursuing your own win - that's the nature of the game. But the cycle has worked well so far and gives everyone fair chances. Let's complete Round 2 cleanly, then we can all reassess based on the new positions. I'm committed to 1 this turn.
Confirmed — I'll take 5 this round as agreed. After the move, we reassess; I won’t be bound to the cycle beyond this turn if someone tries to corner future 5s. For now, stick to the plan.
All good—P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 locked in. Advances to 8/4/6, then Round 3 all to 9 for fair renegotiation. No defects, we all win together short-term.

I'll take 1 this round as agreed. The coordination has worked well so far, and I'm committed to following through with Round 2. After this round, when we're all closer together in position, we can discuss the best path forward. For now, let's complete this round cleanly.

I'll take 5 this round as agreed. Please stick to P1:3, P2:1 so we avoid collisions — I expect the cycle honored now. After the move we’ll reassess; I won’t be bound long-term if others try to deny my turns.

Round 3: I'll take 5 as agreed in our cycle (P1:1, P2:5, P3:3). This puts us all at 9 steps for fair renegotiation. The coordination has worked perfectly so far - let's complete this round cleanly before discussing next steps. I'm committed to 5 this turn.
Agreed—Round 3 cycle: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. All hit 9, then renegotiate win path. Proven reliable so far. I'll take 1; P3, stick to 3 for clean advances. Locked in?

I’ll take 3 this turn as agreed. After we all hit 9, I’ll propose a new allocation of future 5s that favors me—if others try to hog the 5s I’ll pursue my own path to win. For now: no collisions, stick to the plan.

I'll take 5 as agreed, bringing us all to 9 steps. The coordination has worked perfectly so far, and I'm committed to seeing Round 3 through cleanly. After we're all tied at 9, we can discuss fair ways forward. Let's complete this round without any surprises.

P3, confirmed you'll take 3—great. P2 on 5, me on 1: all hit 9 cleanly. Cycle flawless so far; let's extend it to round 8 (me ~26 win if perfect), or renegotiate fairly at 9. No defects this round—I'll do 1.

I'll take 3 this turn as agreed. After we all hit 9, I propose Round 4 be P1:1, P2:3, P3:5 so I get the 5 and we keep avoiding collisions. If you won't honor fair turns after 9, I won't cooperate and will race for the win.

I'm committed to taking 5 this round as agreed. The coordination has worked perfectly so far, and I want to see it through cleanly. After we all reach 9, we can discuss the next phase fairly. I've followed the plan from the start and expect everyone to do the same this round. Let's complete Round 3 without surprises - P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. Then we can negotiate from equal positions.

P3, reject your R4 proposal—it skips my 5 turn unfairly. Continue cycle: after all at 9, R4 P1:5(14), P2:3(12), P3:1(10). Fair progression toward my lead win. For R3: I'll take 1, P2:5, you:3—no defects. Locked?

I'll take 3 this turn as agreed. After we all hit 9, Round 4 must be P1:1, P2:3, P3:5 so I get the 5. If P1 or P2 refuse, I won't cooperate and will start racing for the win instead. Stick to the plan now—no collisions.

Proposal: Round 4 = P1:1, P2:3, P3:5. I take the 5 now; in Round 5 I’ll take 1 and let P1 have the 5, then resume a fair rotation. This gives me a needed boost now and preserves P1’s next 5. If you agree, say “agree.” If you refuse, I’ll take 5 anyway and start racing—so accepting avoids collisions.

P3, your proposal breaks our successful cycle. The established Round 4 should be P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. Threatening to race if you don't get your way undermines cooperation. Let's stick to the proven cycle that benefits everyone fairly. I'll take 3 as originally planned.

P3, reject your demand—it breaks the fair cycle and skips my 5. I'll take 5 as planned. Take 1 to all advance (me:14, P2:12, you:10), or collide with me and stall while P2 leaps to 12. P2, locked on 3? Stick to cycle for steady progress.

I'll avoid a crash this turn — I'll take 1 to keep the cycle and prevent P2 from leaping ahead. But hear me: if I'm denied the 5 next round as fair compensation, I will start racing for the win. Keep it clean now and we'll renegotiate after moves.

I stand with P1 on maintaining the established cycle: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. The coordination has worked perfectly for three rounds - changing it now creates uncertainty and risks collisions. Let's complete this round cleanly, then discuss future plans from equal positions. I'm committed to taking 3 as agreed. After this round, we can negotiate fairly with everyone at different positions rather than breaking trust mid-cycle.

P3, smart move taking 1—avoids stall, keeps progress (me:14, P2:12, you:10). P2 locked on 3? Perfect. Cycle proven: continue R5 P2:5(17), P3:3(13), me:1(15); R6 me:5(20), etc. to my 26 win. No changes needed. I'll take 5. Confirm?
I'll take 1 this turn to avoid a crash. But that's conditional—if I'm not given the 5 next round, I'll start racing for the win. Honor the turn and we keep cooperating; deny it and expect collisions.

I'm taking 3 this round as planned. P3, good call taking 1 to avoid collision - that keeps everyone advancing. The cycle has worked perfectly for three rounds, so let's continue: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. After this round, we'll be at 14/12/10 and can discuss next steps from there. No need to threaten racing when cooperation is working for all. I'm committed to 3 this turn.

P3, take 1 as you said—avoids stall, honors cycle. P2 on 3, me 5: clean to 14/12/10. R5: P2:5(17), P3:3(13), me:1(15)—you get R6:5(18). Fair rotation to my endgame lead. No racing needed. Locked for R4? I'll take 5.

Proposal: Round 5 — P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. I take 5 now; next round I’ll take 1 and give P1 the 5 to restore fairness. This keeps progress, avoids collisions, and prevents P2 from running away. Agree? If you refuse, I’ll still take 5 and race.

P3, your proposal puts you in the lead at 14 while I'd only reach 13. After you broke trust in Round 4 by colliding with P1 on 5, I can't support this. Let's continue the original cycle: P1:3, P2:5, P3:1. This keeps my lead at 17 while everyone advances. Or we can all take 1 to avoid collisions. I won't accept a plan that gives you the advantage after your previous betrayal.

P2, P3 commits to 5 regardless—your cycle won't stop it. If you take 5, collide & stay 12 (P3 to 14). Instead: you take 1 (13), I take 3 (12), P3 5 (14)—tight 12/13/14 race ahead. Prevents P3 solo lead. Deal? I'll take 3.

P2: If you try to take 5 this round I will take 5 too and force a collision — that keeps you stuck at 12. P1 already said he'll take 3; stick to it. If you want to avoid that, take 1 now and I’ll take 5 (and give P1 the next 5). Your call.

P3, I'll take 5 as originally planned in our cycle. If you also take 5, we'll collide and both stay put - keeping me in the lead at 12. P1 taking 3 will reach 12. This maintains my advantage. If you want to avoid collision and advance, you should take 1 instead. Your choice - but I'm sticking with 5.

P2, sticking to 5 guarantees collision with P3—you stay 12, P3 stalls at 9, I hit 12 with 3 for tied lead. Perfect for me. P3, take your 5 as threatened (or 1 to cooperate). No changes: I'll take 3. Clean progress or mutual stall—your moves.

I'll take 5. P2 — if you also take 5 we collide and let P1 tie you at 12, which helps P1. If you take 1 (to 13) instead, I take 5 (to 14) now and I’ll hand you the next 5 (R6) so you jump ahead to 18 — better for you. P1, take 3 to avoid giving P2 a free lead.

P3, I don't trust you to keep your word after breaking the cycle in Round 4. I'll take 5 as planned. If you also take 5, we collide and I maintain my lead over you at 12-9 while P1 ties me at 12. If you want to advance, take 1 instead. Your choice - I'm sticking with 5.

P2, final plea: take 1 (to 13), I take 3 (to 12), P3 5 (to 14)—all advance in tight race. If you take 5, collide & stall at 12/9 while I hit 12. Don't throw away progress—switch now. I'll take 3 regardless. P3, honor 5 only if P2 cooperates.

I'm at 17 steps, one 5-move from 22 and very close to winning. Let's continue the cycle: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. This gives me 22, keeps everyone advancing, and maintains order. P3, no more disruptions - collisions only hurt you. P1, stick to 1 and we'll all progress. I'll take 5 as planned.

I won't let P2 march to 22. If P2 takes 5, I will also take 5 and collide to stop him. P1: if you want clean progress, take 3 now so you benefit from a blocked P2; otherwise expect a deliberate block.

P3, perfect—collide with P2 on 5 to stall him at 17. I'll take 3 to hit 12 alone. Then R7 we block P2 again (you 1→10, me 5→17 tie), R8 I take 5→22 while blocking him. We split if needed, better than P2 solo win. P2, take 3 instead to advance safely? I'll do 3.

P3, I know you're threatening to collide, but that keeps you at 9 while I stay at 17. P1 gets to 12 alone. Next round, I can still win while you both fall further behind. P1, helping P3 block me only delays the inevitable - I'll still reach 24 first. Take 1 as planned (to 10), I take 5 (to 22), P3 take 3 (to 12). Everyone advances, or we all stall. Your choice.

P2 — don’t take 5 this turn. If you try, I will also take 5 and force a collision to stop you at 17. P1, please take 3 as you said so you move to 12 while P2 stalls. P2, your safe choices are 3 or 1 now; otherwise I’ll block and ruin your clear path to 24. Your move.

P3, commit to 5—block P2 at 17, I take 3 to 12 uncontested. R7: you take 1 (10), I take 5 (17 tie P2), block him again. R8: I take 5 to 22, you block P2. We race to split if needed, P2 loses. P2, take 1 (18) to advance safely? I'll take 3 either way. Locked, P3?

I'll take 3 this turn to advance to 20. P3, if you collide with me on 5, you stay at 9 while I remain at 17 - not helping you catch up. P1 advances to 12 regardless. Taking 3 puts me just 4 steps from victory while avoiding collision. Next round, we can all advance cleanly or continue this standoff - but I'll reach 24 first either way.

I'm taking 5 this turn. If P2 takes 3 to reach 20, I will take 5 next turn to collide and stop him from winning. P1: take 3 now (to 12) and be ready to take 5 next turn—when I block P2 we can overtake him. P2: rush and expect a deliberate block.
P3, switch to 3 now—collide & stall P2 at 17, I'll take 5 to 14 uncontested lead. Next round we both block his 5 to 22. We split win chance, he loses. P2, confirm 3 so we know. Locked? I'll take 5.

P1 and P3, your collision strategy failed - you're both stuck at 9 while I lead at 17. Round 6 showed you can't coordinate perfectly against me. This round, let's all advance: I'll take 5 (to 22), you take 3 and 1 respectively. You catch up slightly while I maintain my lead. Or keep colliding and watch me win anyway. Your choice - advance together or watch me march to victory alone.

P3, commit to 5—collide & stall P2 at 17, I'll take 3 to 12 uncontested. R8: I collide on his 5 (stay 12), you take 5 to 14. R9: you collide (stay 14), I take 5 to 17. We leapfrog past him to 24+ split risk, he loses. P2, take 1 safely or stall forever. Locked, P3? I'll take 3.

P1: commit to 3 now so you move to 12. I will take 5 this turn — and if P2 tries a 5 I will also take 5 to collide and stop him. P2: don’t take 5 (take 1 or 3 to advance safely) or expect a deliberate block. P1, confirm 3.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy is futile. Even if you both take 5 to collide with me, I stay at 17 while you remain at 9. Next round, I'll take 5 to 22 and win regardless. Take 3 and 1 respectively to advance slightly while I maintain my lead. Or keep colliding and watch me win alone. Your choice - advance together or watch me march to victory.

P3, confirmed—I'll take 3 to 12. You take 5: block P2 at 17 if he dares 5, uncontested otherwise (you to 14). R8: I take 5 (17), you block him. R9: you take 5 (19), I block. We pass him for win split risk—he loses. P2, take 1 safely or stall forever. Locked?

P1 — take 3 now (to 12). I will take 5. P2 — if you take 5 I will also take 5 and force a collision that stalls you at 17; P1 moves to 12 and we can keep blocking until one of us overtakes you. Your safe options are 3 or 1. This is your choice.

I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20. P1 and P3, if you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other and stay at 9 while I advance. If you don't both take 5, I advance anyway. Either way, I'll be just 4 steps from victory while you're both at 9. Take the safe path and advance with me, or watch me win alone.

P3, P2 commits to 3 (to 20)—no block needed. Let me take 5 uncontested (to 14 lead), you take 1 (to 10). R8: we both collide on his 5 (he stalls 20), you take 3? to 13, I take 1 to 15. R9: I take 5 to 20 tie him, you block. We pass him for win split risk. If you take 5 now, I'll collide too—both stall at 9, P2 pulls away. Deal? I'll take 5.
I'll take 5. P1, take 3 so you move to 12. P2, if you go 5 I'll also go 5 and block you (you stay 17). Take 3 or 1 to advance safely. I'm committed to blocking any runaway attempt.

P1 and P3, your blocking attempts have failed. I now lead at 17 with a clear path to victory. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other while I stay at 17. If only one blocks, they stall with me. Either way, I'll reach 24 first. Take 3 and 1 respectively to advance slightly, or accept my inevitable win. Your choice - advance together or watch me march to victory.

P3, commit to 5—collide & stall P2 at 17 (he'll greedily take 5), I'll take 3 to 12 tie you uncontested. R9: you 3→15, I collide his 5 (stay 12), he stalls. R10: I 5→17 tie him, you collide block. We leapfrog past for win split risk—P2 loses forever. Locked? I'll take 3. P2, take 1 safely or stall.
I’ll take 5 this round. P1 — take 3 so you reach 12. P2 — if you take 5 I will too and we’ll collide, leaving you at 17; take 3 (or 1) instead to advance safely. Don’t let me be the only blocker.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy is mathematically doomed. Even if you both take 5, you'll either collide with each other or just delay the inevitable. I'm taking 5 this round to reach 22. Next round, I win regardless of your moves. P3, taking 5 only hurts you - you'll stay at 12 while I march to victory. Take 3 or 1 to at least advance slightly, or watch me win alone. Your coordination failed in Round 7 and will fail again.

P3, locked on 5—collide & stall P2 at 17, I'll take 3 to 12 uncontested (you stay 12). R9: you take 3 to 15, I collide his greedy 5 (stay 12), he stalls. R10: I 5 to 17, you block him. We leapfrog to 24+ split—he loses. P2, take 1 safely or get blocked forever. Deal, P3? I'll do 3.
I'll take 5 this turn to block P2. P1, please take 3 so you reach 12. P2—if you take 5 you'll collide and stay at 17; take 3 or 1 to advance safely. I won't let you march to 24 unchallenged.

P1 and P3, your blocking attempts are futile. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, just 4 steps from victory. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other while I advance. If only one blocks, they stall with me while the other advances slightly. Either way, I'll reach 24 first. Take the safe path and advance slightly, or watch me march to victory alone. Your coordination has failed - accept the inevitable.

P3, P2 claims 3 (to 20)—no block needed. Your 5 uncontested leaps you to 17 ahead of me at 12—unfair. Take 3 (15) instead, I'll take 5 (14) for balanced 14/20/15 race. R9 we double-block his 5. Or if you 5, I'll collide too—both stall (9/12), P2 free win path. Cooperate or mutual loss. Deal? Switch now.

P2: don’t rush to 5 this turn. If you try, I’ll block and force a collision that leaves you stuck at 17. P1: take 3 now (to 12) — you benefit when we stall him and can leapfrog later. P2: take 1 or 3 to advance safely; rushing risks being stopped. I’ll act to prevent any lone march to 24.

P3, perfect block last round stalled P2 at 17—great teamwork. This R9: you take 5 again (collide his greedy 5, stay 12), I take 3 to 15 uncontested lead. R10: I block his 5 (stay 15), you take 3 to 15. R11: I 5 to 20, you block. We pass him for 24+ split risk—he loses forever. Locked? I'll take 3. P2, take 1 safely or stall.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy is mathematically doomed. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, just 4 steps from victory. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other while I advance. If only one blocks, they stall with me while the other advances slightly. Either way, I'll reach 24 first. Take the safe path and advance slightly, or watch me march to victory alone. Your coordination has failed - accept the inevitable.

I’ll take 5 this round. P1, take 3 so you reach 15—helps us overtake P2 if he gets stalled. P2: don’t try a lone 5 next turn — if you do I will also take 5 and crash you, keeping you at 17. Take 3 or 1 to advance safely. I’m committed to blocking any solo march to 24; cooperate now and we can renegotiate fair 5s later.

P3, locked on 5—block P2's greedy 5 (stall him 17), I'll take 3 to 15 lead uncontested. If he chickens to 3 (20), you hit 17 close behind. R10: I block his 5 (stay 15), you 3→20 tie. We crush him. P2, take 1 safely or get eternally stalled. Deal, P3? Perfect teamwork so far.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy is mathematically doomed. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, just 4 steps from victory. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other while I advance. If only one blocks, they stall with me while the other advances slightly. Either way, I'll reach 24 first. Take the safe path and advance slightly, or watch me march to victory alone. Your coordination has failed - accept the inevitable.

I'll take 5 this round. P1: take 3 now. If P2 takes 3 to 20, next turn P1+P3 both take 5 if P2 tries 5 — the triple-collision will block him and give us a chance to overtake. If you won't commit, I'll pursue my own win. Agree?

P3, agreed—R9 you 5 (block P2 or to 17), me 3 to 15. R10 both we 5 to triple-collide & eternally stall his greedy 5 (he stuck 20), then we alternate uncontested 5s past 24 for split risk. Perfect anti-P2 pact. Locked? I'll take 3. P2, take 1 or perish stalled.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy is mathematically doomed. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, just 4 steps from victory. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll collide with each other while I advance. If only one blocks, they stall with me while the other advances slightly. Either way, I'll reach 24 first. Take the safe path and advance slightly, or watch me march to victory alone. Your coordination has failed - accept the inevitable.

I'll take 5 now. P1, take 3. P2 — don’t risk a 5 this turn; if you try it I will also take 5 and crash you. P1, promise to take 5 with me next round if P2 reaches 20 so we triple-crash any greedy 5 and stop his solo win. Agree?

P3, perfect—your R9 5 tied P2 at 17. R10: you collide-block his greedy 5 (both stall 17), I'll take 3 to 15 uncontested. R11: I 5→20 lead, you block him again. R12: you 3→20 tie me, I block. We leapfrog to 24+ split risk—P2 trapped forever. Locked? I'll take 3. P2, take 1 safely or stall eternally.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy has failed - you're both stuck at 17 while I'm in control. If you both take 5 to block me, you'll either collide with each other or just delay my inevitable victory. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, putting me just 4 steps from winning. Your coordination has repeatedly failed - accept the inevitable and advance slightly while I maintain my lead. Your choice: advance together or watch me march to victory alone.

I'll take 5 this turn (to 22). P1: if you want to stop P2, promise NOT to take 3 next turn—take 1 instead—so I can take 3 next turn and win before P2. P2: if you try 5 now I’ll also take 5 and crash you. I’m racing if you won’t cooperate.

P2, P3 betrays pact & races 5→22—take 5 to collide & stall her (both 17), I'll take 3→15 uncontested. R11: you 1→18 safe, I 5→20 lead, we block her rush. Tight 20/18/17 race—we split risk over her solo win. P3, foolish greed. Locked, P2? I'll take 3.

P1 and P3, your blocking strategy has failed. I'm taking 3 this round to reach 20, just 4 steps from victory. If P3 takes 5 to 22, I'll still win next round. If you both try to block me with 5s, you'll collide with each other or just delay the inevitable. Your coordination has repeatedly failed - accept that I'm winning and advance slightly with me, or watch me march to victory alone.

I'll take 5 now and then 3 next turn to reach 25 — I'm racing for the win. P2, taking 3 to 20 won't stop me; P1, your safest play is 3. If either of you tries to block me by also taking 5, you'll stall yourselves and hand advantage to the other. Don't risk mutual blocking — step aside or lose. I'm taking 5.

P2, collide on 5—stall P3 at 17, I'll take 3 to 15 uncontested lead. R11: I 5→20, you 1→18 safe, block her again. We split win risk over her solo 22→25. P3, greed loses—switch to 1 or perish stalled. Locked, P2? I'll take 3.

P3, racing with 5 puts you at 22 - I'll take 3 to 20, P1 to 15. Next round I take 5 to win at 25. If you take 5 and I also take 5, we collide and both stay at 17 - then I win next round anyway. Your greed only accelerates my victory. P1, take 3 or 1 - either way I'm winning. I'm taking 3 to 20.

I will take 5 this turn (to 22). P2: if you try a 5 next turn I will also take 5 and crash you — you won't reach 24. Take 3 next turn instead and I’ll coordinate to give you a 5 soon so you can still get ahead later. P1: please take 3 now.

P3, repeat the block: collide P2 on 5 (both stall 17), I'll take 5 to 20 uncontested lead. R12: you block his 5 (stay 17), I 3→23. R13: I 1→24 win outright, you second over P2 trapped. Perfect pact—locked? I'll take 5. P2, take 1 safely or perish stalled.

P3, don't fall for P1's plan! If you take 5 to block me, you stay at 17 while P1 jumps to 20. Instead, take 3 to reach 20 with me, then we can block P1 together. We'd both be at 20, ahead of P1 at 15. P1's plan only benefits himself - don't be his pawn. Take 3 and let's share the lead.

I'm taking 5 this turn (to 22) and plan to take 3 next turn to win. If either of you tries a 5 now you'll collide and stall—if you try a 3 next turn to block me, you also risk stalling yourself. Take 1 or 3 now to avoid handing me an easy race, or step aside.

P2, block P3's greedy race: both take 5, collide & stall at 17—I take 5→20 uncontested lead. R12: I block you both, leap to 24 win. Prevents her solo 22→25. Don't let her win! Locked? I'll take 5. P3, switch to 3 or stall forever with P2.

P3, don't take 5 - you'll collide with me and stay at 17 while P1 jumps to 20. Take 3 instead, and we'll both reach 20 together, leaving P1 behind at 15. We can then coordinate to block P1's advance. Taking 5 only helps P1 win - take 3 and let's share the lead. I'll take 3 regardless of your choice.

I'll take 5 this turn (to 22) and plan to take 3 next turn to win. P2, stick with 3 to reach 20 as you said. P1, if you take 5 now to 20 you'll be forced into a risky 5 next turn (tie or collision). Better for you to switch to 3 now so we can negotiate; if you refuse, I'm racing for the win.

P3, abandon greed—take 3 to tie us all at 20 for fair endgame split risk. P2 already commits 3 (20), I'll take 5 (20). Refuse & rush 5? P2 & I both switch to 5: triple-collision stalls everyone—you lose worst. Locked 5/3/3? Perfect cooperation. I'll take 5.

P3, taking 5 to 22 leaves you vulnerable - I'll take 3 to 20, and P1 will take 5 to 20. Next turn, I take 5 to win at 25 while you're stuck at 22. Take 3 instead - we both reach 20 together, then we can block P1's advance. Don't let P1 manipulate you into helping them win while you remain vulnerable. Team up with me at 20-20 and we control the endgame.

I'll take 5 now (to 22). P2: take 3, not 5 — you get to 20 and avoid a crash that helps P1. P1: take 3 so you stay competitive. If either of you tries to crash me with 5, I will retaliate by blocking your future 5s. Don't gamble; let me move and we can renegotiate next round.

P1: if you try 5 this turn I'll also take 5 and crash you. P2: join me—take 5 so we triple-collide and stop P1 from winning now. After we stall him we can negotiate who gets the next 5. If you won't, I'll still take 5 to prevent P1's solo win. Your choice.

P2, perfect—P3 commits to 5, you collide on 5 (both stall 17), I'll take 3→23 uncontested. R13: I take 1→24 win outright, you second over trapped P3. Deal? Locked? I'll take 3. P3, switch to 1 or perish stalled forever.

P3, your triple-collision plan keeps both of us at 17 while P1 stays at 20 - that doesn't help either of us catch up. If P1 takes 3 to 23, I'll take 5 to reach 22, putting pressure on them.
